title: World Athletics Championships: Kenya’s Chebet wins women’s 10,000m gold, big names impress in 100m heats – live

title: Arsenal v Nottingham Forest: Premier League – live
summary: Rob Smyth will cover Ange Postecoglou's return as Nottingham Forest takes on Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium. This highly anticipated match marks a significant moment for Postecoglou. Fans are eager to see how Forest performs against the strong Arsenal side.

title: Thousands gather in London for far-right ‘unite the kingdom’ rally and counter-protest – UK politics live
summary: March is anticipated to host Britain's largest far-right rally in decades, featuring speakers from Britain, the US, and Europe. The event has raised concerns about its potential impact on social tensions and public safety. Authorities are closely monitoring the situation in light of previous incidents related to far-right gatherings.

title: How Charlie Kirk turned campuses into cultural battlefields – and ushered in Trump’s assault on universities
summary: The head of Turning Point USA, who was recently killed, was known for igniting campus culture wars and fostering a divisive environment. He often viewed faculty and students as adversaries rather than collaborators. His leadership style contributed to heightened tensions within academic settings.
